about.summary: NanoString nCounter data are gene expression assays where there is no need for the use of enzymes or amplification protocols and work with fluorescent barcodes (Geiss et al. (2018) <doi:10.1038/nbt1385>). Each barcode is assigned a messenger-RNA/micro-RNA (mRNA/miRNA) which after bonding with its target can be counted. As a result each count of a specific barcode represents the presence of its target mRNA/miRNA. 'NACHO' (NAnoString quality Control dasHbOard) is able to analyse the exported NanoString nCounter data and facilitates the user in performing a quality control. 'NACHO' does this by visualising quality control metrics, expression of control genes, principal components and sample specific size factors in an interactive web application.

NanoString nCounter data are gene expression assays where there is no need for the use of enzymes or amplification protocols and work with fluorescent barcodes (Geiss et al. (2018) <doi:10.1038/nbt1385>). Each barcode is assigned a messenger-RNA/micro-RNA (mRNA/miRNA) which after bonding with its target can be counted. As a result each count of a specific barcode represents the presence of its target mRNA/miRNA. 'NACHO' (NAnoString quality Control dasHbOard) is able to analyse the exported NanoString nCounter data and facilitates the user in performing a quality control. 'NACHO' does this by visualising quality control metrics, expression of control genes, principal components and sample specific size factors in an interactive web application.

name: r-nacho
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.0.6" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-nacho
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/NACHO_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/NACHO/NACHO_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 31cd8a2c9d11ea064634ce0aa6ceae7a0ef7cf7f76aafa7235f4fba2b4bc3eec

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-data.table
    - r-ggbeeswarm >=0.6.0
    - r-ggforce >=0.3.1
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.3.0
    - r-ggrepel >=0.8.1
    - r-knitr >=1.25
    - r-rmarkdown >=1.16
    - r-shiny >=1.4.0
    - r-shinywidgets >=0.4.9
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-data.table
    - r-ggbeeswarm >=0.6.0
    - r-ggforce >=0.3.1
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.3.0
    - r-ggrepel >=0.8.1
    - r-knitr >=1.25
    - r-rmarkdown >=1.16
    - r-shiny >=1.4.0
    - r-shinywidgets >=0.4.9

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('NACHO')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('NACHO')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/mcanouil/NACHO, https://mcanouil.github.io/NACHO
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: NanoString nCounter data are gene expression assays where there is no need for the use of enzymes or amplification protocols and work with fluorescent barcodes (Geiss et al. (2018) <doi:10.1038/nbt1385>). Each barcode is assigned a messenger-RNA/micro-RNA (mRNA/miRNA) which after bonding with its target can be
    counted. As a result each count of a specific barcode represents the presence of its target mRNA/miRNA. 'NACHO' (NAnoString quality Control dasHbOard) is able to analyse the exported NanoString nCounter data and facilitates the user in performing a quality control. 'NACHO' does this by visualising quality control metrics,
    expression of control genes, principal components and sample specific size factors in an interactive web application.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Title: NanoString Quality Control Dashboard
# Version: 1.0.1

# Description: NanoString nCounter data are gene expression assays where there is no need for the use of enzymes or amplification protocols and work with fluorescent barcodes (Geiss et al. (2018) <doi:10.1038/nbt1385>). Each barcode is assigned a messenger-RNA/micro-RNA (mRNA/miRNA) which after bonding with its target can be counted. As a result each count of a specific barcode represents the presence of its target mRNA/miRNA. 'NACHO' (NAnoString quality Control dasHbOard) is able to analyse the exported NanoString nCounter data and facilitates the user in performing a quality control. 'NACHO' does this by visualising quality control metrics, expression of control genes, principal components and sample specific size factors in an interactive web application.
